meanings.definition: behaving in a dishonorable or contemptible way
meanings.sent1: His caddish behavior towards his friends made them upset.
meanings.sent2: It was very caddish of him to cheat on the test.
meanings.sent3: The caddish character in the movie always lied and stole.
meanings.sent4: Her caddish actions left a trail of broken promises.
meanings.sent5: The villain's caddish grin revealed his true nature.

meanings.sent1: The man's caddish manners were evident in his rude comments.
meanings.sent2: She found his caddish behavior unacceptable.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the caddish prince betrayed his kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The caddish gentleman never apologized for his mistakes.
meanings.sent5: His caddish attitude made him unpopular among his peers.

meanings.definition: showing a lack of consideration for others
meanings.sent1: Ignoring her feelings was a caddish thing to do.
meanings.sent2: He displayed a caddish disregard for their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The caddish coworker always took credit for others' work.
meanings.sent4: His caddish behavior at the party offended many guests.
meanings.sent5: The caddish driver cut off other cars without signaling.
